name: Laser Sky
description:
The city skyline at night, under curfew.
A grid of laser beams frames the dark shapes.
Lightning and thunder rock the heavens.
Then it's quiet again... but only for a moment.
Your solitary fight begins anew.

Laser Sky is a side-scrolling shoot'em up with abstract vector art and slow-paced gameplay, suitable for older gamers. It's based on the original prototype of the same name.

System requirements
  • Intel Atom 1.6GHz (minimum) or
  • AMD Athlon 3200+ (recommended);
  • HTML5-capable web browser.
Controls
  • Arrow keys or WASD to move;
  • Space to shoot;
  • P to pause/unpause;
  • M to mute/unmute;
  • Enter to continue after game over.
  • Escape to leave the game early.

In Firefox you can also play with a gamepad: use the left analog stick to move and button 1 to start/fire. Menus can only be navigated with the keyboard.

Credits
  • Sound effects by Stephen M. Cameron; CC-BY-SA.
  • Hi font by Robert Jablonski; SIL Open Font License.
  • Colors taken from the excellent DB32 palette.
